tool.name: Lipidmaps
tool.description: : search on LM online with masses

param.name: file_input
param.label: File of masses (Variable Metadata)
param.help: A tabular/csv file is needed and can contains a header line.

param.name: lineheader
param.label: Number of header lines
param.help: number of lines not containing values

param.name: col_mass
param.label: Masses Column
param.help: select the column in your input file.

param.name: col_rt
param.label: Retention time Column
param.help: select the column in your input file.

param.name: modify_data_action
param.label: Do you want to modify input masses ?
param.help: Posibility to apply oxidation(s) and/or neutral loss(es).

param.name: oxidation
param.label: If you want to transform masses extracted from file with oxidation(s)

param.name: neutral_loss
param.label: If you want to correct masses extracted from file with neutral loss

param.name: complex_query_action
param.label: Do you want to perform a multiple queries on input masses ?
param.help: Choose 'no' to use the following classification on all mz or 'yes' to search each mz on one given cat/class/subclass.

param.name: col_classif_id
param.label: Select the column containing category or class or sub class identifiants in your input file :
param.help: Example : 3 for Glycerophospholipids category, 310 for Glycerophosphates main class or 32001 for a subclass

param.name: filter_cat
param.label: Select a Lipid category for your query

param.name: filter_class
param.label: Select a Lipid main class for your query

param.name: filter_subclass
param.label: Select a Lipid subclass for your query

param.name: decimal
param.label: Number of significant decimal
param.help: Number of significant decimal of your mz.

param.name: round_type
param.label: Type of cut of the masses
param.help: Example 801.1789 is truncate as 801.17 or arround as 801.18 with 2 significant decimal.

param.name: tolerance
param.label: Mass-to-charge ratio
param.help: Default value is 0.5 for LM (mass-to-charge ratio)

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**Authors** Franck Giacomoni
---------------------------------------------------
.. class:: infomark
**Please cite** If you use this tool, please cite | `Sud M., Fahy E., Cotter D., Brown A., Dennis E., Glass C., Murphy R., Raetz C., Russell D., and Subramaniam S. LMSD: LIPID MAPS structure database. Nucleic Acids Research 35, D527-32 (2006). <http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1669719>`_
---------------------------------------------------
============== LIPIDMAPS_WS ==============
----------- Description -----------
| This tool accesses to Structure Database (LMSD) by the LMSDRecord.php service. | It supports retrieval of detailed information for a specific lipid with a valid LMID. | Searches on LMSD using a variety of parameters specified below. | | LMSD querying is very long because LMSD do not allow to hit its server more often than once per 20 seconds. LMSD may have to kill scripts that hit its server more frequently.
----------------- Workflow position -----------------
.. image:: ./static/images/metabolomics/lipidmaps.png :width: 800
----------- Input files -----------
+-------------------------+-----------+ | Parameter : num + label | Format | +=========================+===========+ | 1 : variableMetadata | tabular | +-------------------------+-----------+
Constraints file : * a column with mz * a column with rt * a column with containing category or class or sub class identifiants. [optionnal]
---------- Parameters ----------
Masses Column | mz list using in searches. | Each mz will be arround or truncate and querying to LMSD.
Retention time Column | rt list not using in searches.
Modify input masses | Select posibility to apply oxidation(s) and/or neutral loss(es) | Example : if you apply a oxidation (+ O) on a mz = 800.00, the mass search on LMSD will be 800.00 - 15.99. | A LM return will be : LMGP01010622 PC(16:0/20:3(5Z,8Z,11Z)) C44H82NO8P 783.58 but do not forget to add a Oxigen...
Transform masses extracted from file with oxidation(s) | Choose : + O, + 2 O, + 4 O.
Correct masses extracted from file with neutral loss : | Choose : H2O2 loss, H2O loss
Perform a multiple queries on input masses | Select \'no\' to use the following classification on all mz | or \'yes\' to search each mz on one given cat/class/subclass in file column.
Lipid category | Select a category in the given list
Lipid main class | Select a main class in the given list
Lipid subclass | Select a sub class in the given list
Number of significant decimal | Number of significant decimal of your mz. This parameter will influence the arround on oxidation or neutral loss
Type of cut | truncate or arround the mz with the given significant decimal number | example 801.1789 is truncate as 801.17 or arround as 801.18 with 2 significant decimal.
Delta of mass | Exact mass off set (great as +/- 0.01 to +/- 100)
------------ Output files ------------
lipidmaps_TSV.tabular | the input file with adding lipidmaps results organized by cluster like | delta::Cluster_common_name::Formula::Example_of_LM_id\|... | Example 0.21::(-)::(C42H80NO6P)::LMGP01040094\|0.14::(PC_32:4)::(C40H72NO8P)::LMGP01010499\|0.20::(PC-O_30:0)+H2O2::(C38H78NO7P)+H2O2::LMGP01020012\|
lipidmaps_VIEW.html | A very complete LM results output with clusters.
--------------- Working example ---------------
.. class:: warningmark
Refer to the corresponding `"W4M HowTo" <http://workflow4metabolomics.org/howto>`_ page: | Format Data For Postprocessing | Perform LCMS Annotations
.. class:: warningmark
And their "W4M courses 2015": | Using Galaxy4Metabolomics - W4M table format for Galaxy | Les banques d'annotation - Annotation
